title: Tony Yayo Drags "Cop" & "Rat" Duo Rick Ross & Jimmy Henchman On Twitter

19 
Rick Ross may have just released his ninth studio album, but one rapper in particular isnâ€™t letting the Miami bossâ€™ history as a correctional officer die easily. 
In an emoji-laced tweet sent on March 18, G-Unitâ€™s Tony Yayo appeared to take a subliminal shot at both Ross and James â€œJimmy Henchmanâ€ Rosemond. 
â€œA cop shouting out a rat rappers for you. This shit ainâ€™t real,â€ Tony Yayo wrote. A cop ğŸ‘® shouting out a rat ğŸ€ rappers for you. This shit ain't real. 
â€” Tony Yayo (@TonyYayo) March 18, 2017 
On his Rather You Than Me track â€œIdols Become Rivals,â€ Ross does, in fact, give a shout out to Rosemond. 
â€œNever slippinâ€™, got relationships with the trillest niggas / Tony Draper, J Prince and every Jimmy Henchman,â€ Ross raps on â€œIdols Become Rivals.â€ 
Although feuds have since simmered down, Yayoâ€™s beef with Ross, and Rosemond, in particular, runs Mariana Trench-deep. 
In 2007, Yayoâ€™s beef with Rosemond hit its peak when the G-Unit rapper allegedly assaulted the businessman-turned-drug traffickerâ€™s son as he was on his way to his fatherâ€™s Czar Entertainment office. 
50 Cent would later reference the infamous slap on â€œHold On,â€ rapping â€œOn the phone I heard Yayâ€™ smacked the shit out a kid / Now Jimmy got life, weâ€™ll smack him again.â€ 
Although any issues between Yayo and Ross likely stemmed from 50 Centâ€™s lengthy feud with the MMG founder , Yayo wasnâ€™t above taking the occasional opportunity to shade Rossâ€™ C.O. past. 
Henchmanâ€™s beef with 50, Yayo and G-Unit continues. It was announced in November that he was getting a new murder-for-hire trial for his alleged involvement in the death of G-Unit affiliate Lowell â€œLodi Mackâ€ Fletcher. Speaking with HipHopDX, the mogul said that he is already preparing to drag the feud to court . 
â€œIf I am retried on the murder-for-hire, and this is something that me and my attorneys have discussed already, I am 100 percent calling 50 Cent as a witness,â€ he shared. â€œThe reason Iâ€™m doing that is because there is some underlying stuff that happened throughout this whole thing that made them charge me; that made them feel like they couldâ€™ve gotten a conviction on me. His name came up in my trial more than it needed to. We will be calling 50 Cent to the stand. If the prosecutors wonâ€™t call him, then we will call him because the things they are accusing me of doing to 50 Cent and Tony Yayo definitely didnâ€™t happen.
